instruction: Marinate the pork: In a large pot, combine the pork belly, water to cover, chopped green onions, smashed garlic, sliced ginger, soy sauce, mirin, sake, brown sugar, and honey. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1-1.5 hours, or until the pork is tender and flavorful. Let the pork cool in the marinade for at least 30 minutes before slicing thinly.

Make the dashi: In a large pot, combine the chicken broth, soaked shiitake mushrooms (reserve soaking liquid), kombu seaweed, smashed garlic, and sliced ginger. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Simmer for 30 minutes, then remove and discard the kombu seaweed. Strain the broth through a fine-mesh sieve to remove the shiitake mushrooms and any solids.
Season the broth: Add the soy sauce, mirin, sake, and reserved shiitake mushroom soaking liquid (optional) to the strained broth. Simmer for an additional 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Cook the ramen noodles according to package instructions. Drain and rinse briefly with hot water.
Heat the broth: Bring the seasoned broth back to a simmer over medium heat.

Assemble the bowls: Divide the cooked ramen noodles between two serving bowls. Top each bowl with slices of chashu pork (if using), narutomaki (if using), ajitsuke tamago halves (if using), and a sheet of nori seaweed. Ladle the hot broth over the noodles and toppings.
Garnish (optional): Garnish with sliced green onions, bamboo shoots, corn, or your favorite ramen toppings.
Serve: Enjoy your shoyu ramen hot and flavorful!
